intro: Espeletia pycnophylla var. lacinulata, commonly known as the Lacinulate Espeletia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and compact growth habit, typical of the Espeletia genus. The plant produces showy, pink to red inflorescences that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often found in cloud forests and páramo ecosystems.
